intro: Notholirion campanulatum, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, demonstrating a high tolerance for drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to minimize water loss. Notholirion campanulatum is often found in rocky soils and is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
